page.title: 03FARMING IN BRADWELL
page.content: The main crop grown at{Eastles farm is wheat. The other crops on the farm are potatoes, rape, linseed, peas and barley. As we went around we counted all the machines. There were 32 altogether. These included tractors, trailers, a combine harvester and a potato sorter. Two extra men are employed in the winter to sort and bag up the potatoes.The potatoes are sold locally. Last year they grew 1000 tonnes. The potatoes are stored in the barn. In the barn is a special machine which emits a high frequency sound to frighten the mice away. They also have cows on the farm during the winter.There were 27 last year.The cows have to be fattened up for market. They eat potatoes and hay.
